name: Guido Araujo
content: Bio – Guido Araujo Search for: Guido Araujo received his Ph.D. degree from Princeton University in 1997.  He was a compiler consultant for Conexant Semiconductor Systems and Mindspeed Technologies from 1997 to 2000 (California, USA). He was an Adjunct Professor at the University of Alberta, Canada, from 2020 to 2023, and a member of the Editorial Board of IEEE MICRO (2023-2025).  He represents Brazil in the RISC-V International Technical Steering Committee. He has published over 150 scientific papers. Together with his students, he was a co-recipient of six Best Paper Awards in IEEE/ACM  conferences. His students received the Best National Thesis/Dissertation Award from the Brazilian Computer Society in 2005 and 2024, as well as the CAPES Ministry of Education Best Thesis Award of 2005. He was awarded two Inventor of the Year and two Zeferino Vaz Research Awards from the University of Campinas (UNICAMP). He received the 2025 Outstanding Researcher Award from the Computer Architecture and HPC Committee of the Brazilian Computing Society (SBC). His primary research interests at UNICAMP included code optimization, parallel programming, computer architecture, and hardware acceleration for AI. He has developed these in close cooperation with Microsoft, Intel, Samsung, LG Electronics, Xilinx, and universities in the USA, Canada, and Spain. He is a retired Senior Professor of Computer Science and Engineering at UNICAMP and a co-founder of Celera Systems (celera.ai), where he researches new techniques for code optimization, parallelizing compilers, and compiling for accelerators. He co-founded the companies Kryptus, Idea!, and Celera.AI. For a Full CV, please refer to this link. DISCLAIMER: This is a personal page and not an official UNICAMP page.
